item.title: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) library(knitr) opts_chunk$set(fig.align="center", fig.height=5, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=8, tidy=TRUE) Data Wrangling and Data Exploration Andrew Lee ml45932 ##0 Introduction getwd() performance<-read.csv("exam.csv",TRUE,",") medicalcost<-read.csv("insurance.csv",TRUE,",") The first dataset is about student performance in three different(subjects) exams along with parental education level and completion of test preparation. The second dataset is about individual's medical cost charged by healthcare insurance companies. As I'm interested in healthcare and medicine, I'd like to know if there is any interesting relationship between student's performance and the cost of insurance with consideration of factors like economic, personal, and social.
